channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Greetings from Mexico City, where these dogs ride a bus to and from school
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international correspondents share snapshots of moments from their lives and work around the wor...

item.title: Operation Rainbow Space Baby: An astronaut's journey with IVF
item.description: Struggling to have a second child, astronaut Kellie Gerardi uses her social media presence to let others know they're not alone.

item.title: Steel tariffs double. And, Congress asked to eliminate public broadcasting funds
item.description: Tariffs on imported steel and aluminum are doubling today. Here's how it could impact your wallets. And, Trump has asked Congress to wipe out funding ...

item.title: Making the case for housing as a human right
item.description: And Housing for All is an impressively comprehensive examination of homelessness in America by Maria Foscarinis, who has worked in homelessness advoca...

item.title: To get from experience to emotion, the brain hits 'sustain'
item.description: A study of mice and people looks at how the brain takes an experience, like being cut off in traffic, and responds with an emotion, like road rage.

item.title: BBC rejects incorrect White House claims on Gaza coverage
item.description: The corporation says claims that a story was removed from its website are "completely wrong".

item.title: Musk calls Trump's tax bill a 'disgusting abomination'
item.description: Billionaire says the bill, which faces a key test in the Senate, undercuts efforts to slash federal spending.

item.title: 'All Jewish Americans are questioning their security' after violent antisemitic attacks
item.description: Community leaders say people are anxious after recent attacks in Boulder and Washington DC showed that “anyone, anywhere” could be targeted.

item.title: Trump budget bill would increase deficit by $2.4 trillion, CBO says
item.description: Republicans' sweeping policy bill would increase the deficit by $2.4 trillion over the next decade, the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office said.

item.title: How Charlene Kaye is rewriting the rules of pop
item.description: Charlene Kaye's musical parodies are racking up millions of views. But her story runs deeper.

item.title: Pride marketing toned down this year amid Trump's DEI crackdown
item.description: Companies are pulling back Pride Month marketing this year amid President Trump's executive orders targeting diversity, equity and inclusion initiativ...

item.title: Act now to save lives in Gaza, ICRC head urges world leaders
item.description: Mirjana Spoljaric has appealed to world leaders to intervene in the conflict in Gaza.

item.title: South African politician sacked over visit to fugitive pastor
item.description: South Africa is trying to extradite pastor Shepherd Bushiri from Malawi on fraud charges, which he denies.

item.title: President Trump's budget bill faces hurdles as Elon Musk calls it "a disgusting abomination"
item.description: Billionaire Elon Musk, a close ally of President Trump, called Mr. Trump's massive budget bill "a disgusting abomination" amid estimates that it could...

item.title: Arrest in connection with Palm Springs bombing made at NYC's JFK airport
item.description: A person was arrested in New York City related to the investigation of last month's bombing outside a fertility clinic in Palm Springs, California.

item.title: Boulder suspect backed off his initial plan to kill all in a group he called ‘Zionist,’ police say
What we know about the man charged in the attack in Boulder, Colorado
Oil and gas have boomed in New Mexico, but fumes from wells are affecting schoolkids
